info.name: SoftDesk_API
info.description:
# SoftDesk

This collection contains all request from the SoftDesk API.

Here you will find all the endpoints with the documentation to make them work.

item.name: Users

request.description:
# login/

## permit to recieve a token accès when you use a valid account.

it returns to you access token and refresh token.

by default in the API the configuration indicates that the duration of validity of the token is 5 minutes. 
To renew the token, it will be necessary to pass by the endpoint login/refresh/

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/login/

request.description:
# signup

This request permit you to create a new account for the API.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/signup/

request.description:
# login/refresh/

This endpoint permit to you to refresh an invalid token. 
Take the refresh token in the login/ endpoint, and take this in the body, with the key 'refresh'. 

It will be send you a new valid access token.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/login/refresh/

request.description:
# users/

This endpoint is made for the administration site. 
It displays all existing user accounts. 

You need to be a super user to view this information. It does not allow modification or deletion, just the display of information.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/users/

item.description:
# Users

This folder contains all information about users 

- user registration
- user login

item.name: Projects

request.description:
# projects/

method GET

This can recieve all projects attached to the connected user. 
To obtain a user's token, simply use the endpoint login/, enter the user's login/password to retrieve their authentication token. 

You have to retrieve the user's access token and place it in the header, with the 'authorization' key, preceed by the key work Bearer, like the example bellow.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects

request.description:
# projects/ 

This endpoint permits you to create a new project. 

By default it will create you like the autor af this project. You could had new contributor/autor after, with the endpoint projects/{id}/users/

This endpoint is protected. Only authenticated users could acces --> You have to retrieve the user's access token and place it in the header, with the 'authorization' key, preceed by the key work Bearer, like the example bellow.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects

request.description:
# projects/{id}

permit you to display details of one project. 

You have to be a contributor/autor to display a project. 

This endpoint is protected. Only authenticated users could acces --> You have to retrieve the user's access token and place it in the header, with the 'authorization' key, preceed by the key work Bearer, like the example bellow.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

formdata.value: Test - PUT modification du titre uniquement

request.description:
# projects/{id}/

This endpoint allows you to update a project : 

- title : update the projcet's title
- description : update the project's description
- type : update the type of the project's plateform.


This endpoint is protected. Only authenticated users could acces --> You have to retrieve the user's access token and place it in the header, with the 'authorization' key, preceed by the key work Bearer, like the example bellow.

Only author of the project is allowed to modify the project.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}

formdata.value: Test - PUT modification du titre uniquement

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}

formdata.value: Test - PUT modification du titre uniquement

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

formdata.value: Test - PUT modification du titre uniquement

request.description:
#projects/{id}

This endpoint allows you to delete a project. When you delete a project, you also delete the problems and contributors to the project.

This endpoint is protected. Only authenticated users could acces --> You have to retrieve the user's access token and place it in the header, with the 'authorization' key, preceed by the key work Bearer, like the example bellow.

Only author of the project is allowed to delete the project.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}

formdata.value: Test - PUT modification du titre uniquement

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}

formdata.value: Test - PUT modification du titre uniquement

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

item.description:
# Projects

This folder contains all informations about projects - 

- view projects
- create a new project
- update a project
- delete a project

item.name: Collaborators

request.description:
# projects/{id}/collaborators/

Allows you to see all contributors of a project.

This endpoint is protected. Only authenticated users could acces --> You have to retrieve the user's access token and place it in the header, with the 'authorization' key, preceed by the key work Bearer, like the example bellow.

Only contributors of a project can see all contributors of a project.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/
127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/
127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/

request.description:
# projects/{id}/contributors/

This endpoint allows you to add new contributors to a project. 

You can choose beetween 'COLLABOTRATOR' or 'AUTHOR' for the 'role' field. 
In the user field, you must fill in the user's email address. 

You must be an AUTHOR of the project to do this.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/
127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/
127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/
127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/

request.description:
# projects/{id}/contributors/

This endpoint allows you to delete a contributor.

You must be an AUTHOR of the project to do this.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

item.description:
# Collaborators

 This folder contains all informations to manage collaborators of a project

- add a collaborator to a project
- view all users attached to a project
- delete a project'user

item.name: Issues

request.description:
# projects/{id}/issues/

This endpoint allows all contrubutors of a project to see all issues of this project.

You must be a contributor (AUTOR or CONTRIBUTOR) of the project to see them issues.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/issues/
response.body:
{
    "count": 3,
    "next": null,
    "previous": null,
    "results": [

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/issues/
127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/issues/

request.description:
# project/{id}/issues/
This endpoint allows all contrubutors of a project to add a new project's issue.

You must be a contributor (AUTOR or CONTRIBUTOR) of the project to add a new project's issue.

propriity choices:
- LOW
- MEDIUM
- HIGH

tag choices : 
- BUG
- IMPROVEMENT
- TASK

status choices : 
- TODO 
- IN_PROGRESS
- COMPLETED

assignee_user : mail address of the assignee user

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/
127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/collaborators/

127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/issues/

request.description:
# projects/{id}/issues/{id}
This endpoint allows all contrubutors of a project to add a new project's issue.

You must be the autor of project's issue to modify the issue.
You could modify partial or all items of an issue.

propriity choices:
- LOW
- MEDIUM
- HIGH

tag choices :
- BUG
- IMPROVEMENT
- TASK

status choices :
- TODO
- IN_PROGRESS
- COMPLETED

assignee_user : mail address of the assignee user

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/issues/

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

response.body:
{
    "title": "Modification du titre 1",
    "desc": "First description",

    "tag": "TASK",

    "status": "IN_PROGRESS",
    "author_user": 10,
    "assignee_user": 8,
    "created_time": "2021-11-23T15:05:43.092503Z"
}

item.description:
This folder contains all informations about issues of one project -

- view issues
- create a new issue
- update an issue
- delete an issue

item.name: Comments

request.description:
# projects/{id}/issues/{id}/comments/

This endpoint allows all contrubutors of a project to see all comments of an issue.

You must be a contributor (AUTOR or CONTRIBUTOR) of the project to see them comments.

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/issues/{id}/comments/

request.description:
# projects/{id}/issues/{id}/comments/

This endpoint allows all contrubutors of a project to add comments of an issue.

You must be a contributor (AUTOR or CONTRIBUTOR) of the project to see them comments.

description : characters to the comment

response.name: 127.0.0.1:8000/projects/{id}/issues/{id}/comments/

This endpoint allows to modify a comment of an issue.

You must be author of the comment to update them

- view comments

- create a new comment

- delete a comment
